resources.string:
The Institute was founded in 1973/1974 on two main purposes:
 - to create in a dislocated area of our territory a secondary school offering different education options
 - to innovate by introducing some new courses and an experimental model of organization.
 The Institute was included by the Ministry of Public Administration among the school members of the National Plan of Information Technology.
 In 1998 the Institute was named "Carlo Emilio Gadda" to show its double role in education both in human and scientific field.
 In 2000, the Bardi Project was introduced with the objective of decentralizing the first two years of secondary school in the territory of Bardi.
 In 2011 a Scientific and Technical Committee was instituted with some local companies. It is made up of some entrepreneurs and teachers and it has a consultative and proactive function.
 Since 2012 the school has been identified as Technical Professional Polo for Mechanics with deliberation of the Regional Commission of 17/12/2012.
 Our school offers three study courses split in four branches:
 “Liceo Scientifico opzione Scienze Applicate” is a course mainly focused on scientific subjects:
 o Chemistry;
 o Earth Science;
 o Biology
 o Latin studies are not expected and are substituted by IT studies.
 “Technical” course:
 o Information technology :
 Is a course focused on the achievement of IT and TLC skills. The main subjects are:
 Science and applied technology
 Computer studies
 o Economical course of Administration, Finance and Marketing:
 This is a type of course focused on the study of business, economics, public relations with a degree in economics.
 The main subjects are:
 Law;
 Political Economy;
 Business Economics;
 Two foreign languages
 The final competences to be achieved are in banking, accountancy, sale and marketing fields.
 “Professional course”:
 “MAT” is a type of course concentrated on the professional subjects where most part of the lessons take place in laboratories.
 It proposes two branches: electrical and mechanical.
 The Institute also offers the possibility to follow some extra-curricular courses in view of the achievement of some certifications recognized by the European Framework.
; The certifications proposed are:
 - LANGUAGE CERTIFICATIONS: students can improve their knowledge certifying their competences in foreign languages.
 For the English language:
 PET (Preliminary English Test) level B1
 FCE (First Certificate in English) level B2
 For the French language:
 DELF (Diplo'me E'tranger Langue Francaise) levels B1 and B2
 - ECDL (European Computer Driving Licence): it allows to improve computer and IT software knowledge.
 - CAD (Computer-Aided Drafting): it allows to improve IT drafting software knowledge.
 Every year the Institute also offers students the possibility to have a school-work experience in local businesses, to encourage cooperative relationships between school and working context.
 Some classes are also engaged in drama modules completely developed in foreign languages.
 The Institute organizes some full-immersion weeks at school or abroad to improve language skills in a real communicative context.

Starting from the school year 2014/2015, at the Institute “C. E. Gadda” of Fornovo di Taro, the new first class of the high School Applied Science option will be characterized by a Plan of Study that is particularly innovative.\n
The disciplines related to the Technological and Scientific background will be faced with new teaching methodologies in collaboration with the major companies present on our territory.\n
In fact, companies such as Dallara, Bercella, Turbocoating, share a great boost to the research and technological innovation, have expressed interest to engage in perspective with the School.\n
A School is able to develop a solid scientific culture through an approach that is technologically advanced, capable of giving maximum value to the students and to allow for the enhancement of excellence. \n
“What we are doing as a company, we are doing for our area. In a global competition, the challenge is not between individual companies but between the local systems that will compete for the future. The dissemination of the technical-scientific culture and the integration between education, education, training and innovative economic and productive fabric represent a strategic factor to maintain, or increase, the competitiveness on the international markets. In this perspective, we watch with interest the initiative, promoted by the Institute Gadda of Fornovo, to enrich the high School Science Applied Science option, with the introduction of innovative elements under the aspect of the methodology-instrumental and experimental-laboratory” (Andrea Pontremoli - CEO Dallara Automobili S.p.A.)
